alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 5:37PM EDT until August 14 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES COUNTIES... At 537 PM EDT, the public reported flash flooding in Northeast DC. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported flash flooding on Rhode Island Avenue Northeast. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bethesda... College Park... Greenbelt... Langley Park... Forestville... Largo... Coral Hills... Bladensburg... RFK Stadium... University of Maryland... Fedex Field... Gallaudet University... Fort Totten... Howard University... Landover... Camp Springs... Hyattsville... Takoma Park... East Riverdale... Adelphi... This includes the following Flood Prone Roads: Rhode Island Ave NE between 2nd and Capitol... Beach Dr from Broad Branch Rd to Piney Branch Pkwy... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Basement flooding can occur quickly and create a life-threatening situation. If you are in a basement, or a residence below street level, move to a higher floor immediately.
